data.title: Fun place.
data.text: Organized not rushed lot of family laughs  crazy 3D my first time for that...clean restroom,nice staff. I would definitely recommend...

data.title: FUN, FUN, FUN
data.text: Had an awesome time we had so much fun and no matter what the weather its indoors so the fun never stops.

data.title: so much fun!
data.text: brought my daughter here for her birthday and she had a blast! she said it was her best birthday yet!

data.title: Try saying HELLO........
data.text:
Went with my kids, opened the door walked in said Hi, only to be stared at by a blond girl behind the desk, she just stared at us, until I finally said 3 for golf, she told us the price, we paid but then I  had to  ask her for putters, scorecards, balls. Me & my kids spend a month away every summer, my son loves mini golf & Although it was fun to play 3d/blacklight, I would never go back there.
They are too many other options, why pay to deal with rudeness.

data.title: Best golf!
data.text: So much fun for all ages. Wearing the 3D glasses make it much more challenging but your family will have a lot of laughs.

data.title: Fun but short
data.text: It was a fun activity but my husband and I made it through all ten holes within 20 minutes. And it's so short that if you try to take your time the next group of people catch up to you, so you kind of feel rushed to finish.

data.title: Great for Kids!
data.text: We visited here during spring break for an indoor activity since the weather was cold.  The price was great ($18 for a family of three including a $1 off per person coupon out of the Sunny Days).  You get ten holes of golf which took our family about thirty minutes to complete.  The inside is done in an underwater nautical theme and our son loved it.  You wear 3D glasses and everything is lit up with black lights.  Pretty cool experience.  We went back the next evening a bit later but they were closed.  Will visit again for family fun.  Clean establishment and friendly staff.

data.title: Great for a rainy day.
data.text: It's fun, different, convenient, and affordable. Not the most difficult course or anything over the top. Just for the 3D black light effect, go check it out.

data.title: Interesting Concept
data.text: Overall it was a good experience. The 3-D golf was very fun, especially since it caused a little confusion on where to aim. The only downside is that there are only 10 holes rather than 18 so your game ends pretty quickly, but other than that it was fun!

data.title: A fun 3D experience!
data.text: This is a fun place with funky black lighting.  A short 10 hole putting experience that is fun for the whole family.  Only downside is that it only takes about a half hour.  Our family age range was 4 to 72 and we all had a good time.

data.title: Was a nice distraction
data.text: We tried to visit last year but could never get anyone on phone. This year we were successful! Much smaller than I expected but the black light and 3 D glasses were a really neat change. Only $7 and only 10 holes but kids would really like it.

data.title: Was fun
data.text:
Outside it looks shabby! Needs work!

But was good family fun on the inside. Kind of small and cramped inside but really neat with 3D glasses and black light makes it have a fun edge! We purchased a groupon
But found prices not to be bad even without a discount. Overall it would be a great rainy day activity but expect waiting ..👍

data.title: Small but super fun!
data.text: We went on a groupon so of course it was a good deal. The place is small. And you get stuck waiting near the end for your final hole. It's in a U shape, up one side and around and down the other for I think 10-12 holes. We were only in there 30-45 minutes tops so it went quick. Not sure I'd pay full price but it was beautiful and the 3D effects were better than any movie I've seen.

data.title: Fun fun fun.
data.text: Took our grandson (6 yrs. old ) and he had a blast. Yes, it's  a small place, but if kids have fun and enjoy themselves, isn't that what is all about? Grandson could not really wear the 3D glasses long, but to see his reaction and hear him laughing, it was well worth the stop.

data.title: 3D fun for the family
data.text:
I cannot deny that I had a ball here with my kids. I can honestly said I did not see that coming. I have said NO to my kids wanting to come here for so many years that I caved in last week and said oh well. From the outside the place looks totally dive. That should have been a clue for me to check it out right?

We went in on a weekday morning with no other customers. I looked for coupons in Sunny Days, but found none. I knew it would be more than what it was worthy and found the $7 per head with no discounts for kids to be price for 10 holes of mini golf. The male attendant was very nice and friendly. The clubs, balls, score cards and pencils are given to you along with the most important items of all...3D glasses. 

So on hole #1 we all put our glasses on and I must say it is pretty darn freaky and in spectacular kind of way. I would have never thought that it would be that cool, but it was. Everything just comes out at you and if you feel disoriented don't be surprised. The club even has paint on it giving it a 3D feel and strangely enough you can't even tell if your club is level. After we all did horrible on this hole we kicked them off to try our luck on #2 and did better. 

Your group can decide on, or off of the glasses. Either way these shore little holes offer challenge. We had a blast with them and never got a hole in one. The favorite hole of most is #9 and a must to keep the glasses on. You will swear your hitting the ball straight and it will roll all over the place on a slightly uneven floor...those stinkers! Allow around 30 min to play, or it could be longer I suppose when they are busy. 

There is also a party table in the back where the restrooms are for groups. When back in the area I did hit up the restrooms and found them clean. As a matter of fact the whole place was clean with only one piece of debris on the course. 

So why not a 5 after such a glowing review? The price is steep to me for around 25-30 min of play. Also, when asking the attendant about coupons he said they are around, but did not offer where. I found out just after walking out that the Monster book had $1 off coupons. It would have been easy for him to just say that, he did not have to supply us with them. Heck for a $3 saving I would have went around the corner and grabbed them. 

Something to also consider is the amount of competition with mini golf that are larger and more reasonable. This is only one of two indoors, could be a pro if rain, con if nice day. Do a little research to find what best suit your family, or group. 

Overall I definitely recommend this place as a fun outing with friends, family and the kids. There is no way you will not have a great time.

data.title: Unique, fun and minimal time investment
data.text: Unique mini golf outing.  3d golf, neon clubs, balls and atmosphere, and challenging holes on the positive side. Smaller than usual mini golf, but we enjoyed the quick trip by.

data.title: Only worth it if no one else is there
data.text:
It is only 9-10 holes, so it could go really fast if you need to keep pace with the crowds.  Luckily we got in right before they shut it down for a birthday party, so we played each hole a few times.

Kids abandoned the 3-D glasses for most of the visit.  Only one hole had a 3-D effect, the rest of the "3-D" was the decorations.

Good chance to get out of the heat in the middle of the day, but wouldn't bother again.

data.title: Cool idea
data.text: This could be a cool course, but it needs to be bigger. We had a number of golfing parties crammed together. Essentially, it is a small room with cool 3D effects (that'll impress the kids).

data.title: Really?
data.text: We woke the guy up and gave him our 7 bucks each (forgot the coupon for the buck off, left it in the room).  I have sneezed longer than it took to play these 9 holes.  The 3-D effect was amusing on the 8th hole but that's about it.  Go around the corner and play the jungle or pirate courses, they may be outside (so go at night so it's not too hot) but far better.

data.title: Neat idea!
data.text: This place looks scarey from the outside but don't be fooled! This was a nice break from the hot sun and had a really cool idea for mini golf. Not only is it black light reactive inside but you also get 3D glasses to wear which makes the paint appear 3D. It makes an added challenge when trying to golf. We had a blast!
